本电子版仅供非商业用途。

  1. PROBABILITY AND INFERENCE
    概率与推断
    this section we briefly review these assumed prerequisites and clarify some further notational conventions used in the remainder of the book. Appendix A provides information on some commonly used probability distributions.
    本节中我们简要回顾这些假定的前提条件，并澄清本书其余部分使用的一些记号约定。附录 A 提供了一些常用概率分布的信息。
As introduced in Section 1.3, we generally represent joint distributions by their joint probability mass or density function, with dummy arguments reflecting the name given to each variable being considered. Thus for two quantities u u uu and v v vv, we write the joint density as p ( u , v ) p ( u , v ) p(u,v)p(u, v); if specific values need to be referenced, this notation will be further abused as with, for example, p ( u , v = 1 ) p ( u , v = 1 ) p(u,v=1)p(u, v=1).
如在第 1.3 节中所介绍的，我们通常用联合概率质量或概率密度函数来表示联合分布，函数的虚拟变量名称反映了所考虑的每个变量的名称。因此对于两个量 u u uu 和 v v vv ，我们将联合密度写为 p ( u , v ) p ( u , v ) p(u,v)p(u, v) ；如果需要引用具体数值，这一记法有时会被进一步滥用，例如 p ( u , v = 1 ) p ( u , v = 1 ) p(u,v=1)p(u, v=1) 。
In Bayesian calculations relating to a joint density p ( u , v ) p ( u , v ) p(u,v)p(u, v), we will often refer to a conditional distribution or density function such as p ( u ∣ v ) p ( u ∣ v ) p(u∣v)p(u \mid v) and a marginal density such as p ( u ) = ∫ p ( u , v ) d v p ( u ) = ∫ p ( u , v ) d v p(u)=int p(u,v)dvp(u)=\int p(u, v) d v. In this notation, either or both u u uu and v v vv can be vectors. Typically it will be clear from the context that the range of integration in the latter expression refers to the entire range of the variable being integrated out. It is also often useful to factor a joint density as a product of marginal and conditional densities; for example, p ( u , v , w ) = p ( u ∣ v , w ) p ( v ∣ w ) p ( w ) p ( u , v , w ) = p ( u ∣ v , w ) p ( v ∣ w ) p ( w ) p(u,v,w)=p(u∣v,w)p(v∣w)p(w)p(u, v, w)=p(u \mid v, w) p(v \mid w) p(w).
在涉及联合密度 p ( u , v ) p ( u , v ) p(u,v)p(u, v) 的贝叶斯计算中，我们常常会提到条件分布或密度函数例如 p ( u ∣ v ) p ( u ∣ v ) p(u∣v)p(u \mid v) 以及边缘密度例如 p ( u ) = ∫ p ( u , v ) d v p ( u ) = ∫ p ( u , v ) d v p(u)=int p(u,v)dvp(u)=\int p(u, v) d v 。在此记法中， u u uu 和 v v vv 中的任一项或两项都可以是向量。通常从上下文可以清楚地看出后一个表达式中的积分范围是指被积分变量的整个取值范围。将联合密度分解为边缘密度和条件密度的乘积也常常是有用的；例如， p ( u , v , w ) = p ( u ∣ v , w ) p ( v ∣ w ) p ( w ) p ( u , v , w ) = p ( u ∣ v , w ) p ( v ∣ w ) p ( w ) p(u,v,w)=p(u∣v,w)p(v∣w)p(w)p(u, v, w)=p(u \mid v, w) p(v \mid w) p(w) 。
Some authors use different notations for distributions on parameters and observables for example, π ( θ ) , f ( y ∣ θ ) π ( θ ) , f ( y ∣ θ ) pi(theta),f(y∣theta)\pi(\theta), f(y \mid \theta) - but this obscures the fact that all probability distributions have the same logical status in Bayesian inference. We must always be careful, though, to indicate appropriate conditioning; for example, p ( y ∣ θ ) p ( y ∣ θ ) p(y∣theta)p(y \mid \theta) is different from p ( y ) p ( y ) p(y)p(y). In the interests of conciseness, however, our notation hides the conditioning on hypotheses that hold throughout - no probability judgments can be made in a vacuum - and to be more explicit one might use a notation such as the following:
有些作者对参数和可观测量的分布使用不同的记号，例如 π ( θ ) , f ( y ∣ θ ) π ( θ ) , f ( y ∣ θ ) pi(theta),f(y∣theta)\pi(\theta), f(y \mid \theta) ——但这会掩盖一个事实：在贝叶斯推断中，所有的概率分布具有相同的逻辑地位。不过我们始终必须小心地标明适当的条件；例如， p ( y ∣ θ ) p ( y ∣ θ ) p(y∣theta)p(y \mid \theta) 与 p ( y ) p ( y ) p(y)p(y) 是不同的。为了简洁起见，我们的记号隐藏了对始终成立的假设的条件——没有任何概率判断可以在真空中进行——若要更明确一些，可以使用如下记法：
p ( θ , y ∣ H ) = p ( θ ∣ H ) p ( y ∣ θ , H ) p ( θ , y ∣ H ) = p ( θ ∣ H ) p ( y ∣ θ , H ) p(theta,y∣H)=p(theta∣H)p(y∣theta,H)p(\theta, y \mid H)=p(\theta \mid H) p(y \mid \theta, H)
where H H HH refers to the set of hypotheses or assumptions used to define the model. Also, we sometimes suppress explicit conditioning on known explanatory variables, x x xx.
其中 H H HH 指用于定义模型的一组假设或前提。此外，我们有时也省略对已知解释变量 x x xx 的显式条件表示。
We use the standard notations, E ( ⋅ ) E ( ⋅ ) E(*)\mathrm{E}(\cdot) and var ( ⋅ ) var ( ⋅ ) var(*)\operatorname{var}(\cdot), for mean and variance, respectively:
我们使用标准记号 E ( ⋅ ) E ( ⋅ ) E(*)\mathrm{E}(\cdot) 和 var ( ⋅ ) var ( ⋅ ) var(*)\operatorname{var}(\cdot) 分别表示均值和方差：
E ( u ) = ∫ u p ( u ) d u , var ( u ) = ∫ ( u − E ( u ) ) 2 p ( u ) d u E ( u ) = ∫ u p ( u ) d u , var ( u ) = ∫ ( u − E ( u ) ) 2 p ( u ) d u E(u)=int up(u)du,quad var(u)=int(u-E(u))^(2)p(u)du\mathrm{E}(u)=\int u p(u) d u, \quad \operatorname{var}(u)=\int(u-\mathrm{E}(u))^{2} p(u) d u
For a vector parameter u u uu, the expression for the mean is the same, and the covariance matrix is defined as
对于向量参数 u u uu ，均值的表达式相同，协方差矩阵定义为
var ( u ) = ∫ ( u − E ( u ) ) ( u − E ( u ) ) T p ( u ) d u var ( u ) = ∫ ( u − E ( u ) ) ( u − E ( u ) ) T p ( u ) d u var(u)=int(u-E(u))(u-E(u))^(T)p(u)du\operatorname{var}(u)=\int(u-\mathrm{E}(u))(u-\mathrm{E}(u))^{T} p(u) d u
where u u uu is considered a column vector. (We use the terms ‘variance matrix’ and ‘covariance matrix’ interchangeably.) This notation is slightly imprecise, because E ( u ) E ( u ) E(u)\mathrm{E}(u) and var ( u ) ( u ) (u)(u) are really functions of the distribution function, p ( u ) p ( u ) p(u)p(u), not of the variable u u uu. In an expression involving an expectation, any variable that does not appear explicitly as a conditioning variable is assumed to be integrated out in the expectation; for example, E ( u ∣ v ) E ( u ∣ v ) E(u∣v)\mathrm{E}(u \mid v) refers to the conditional expectation of u u uu with v v vv held fixed - that is, the conditional expectation as a function of v v vv-whereas E ( u ) E ( u ) E(u)\mathrm{E}(u) is the expectation of u u uu, averaging over v v vv (as well as u u uu ).
其中 u u uu 被视为列向量。（我们将“方差矩阵”和“协方差矩阵”交替使用。）这种记法有些不够精确，因为 E ( u ) E ( u ) E(u)\mathrm{E}(u) 和 var ( u ) ( u ) (u)(u) 实际上是分布函数 p ( u ) p ( u ) p(u)p(u) 的函数，而不是变量 u u uu 的函数。在包含期望的表达式中，任何没有明确作为条件变量出现的变量都被假定在期望中被积分掉；例如， E ( u ∣ v ) E ( u ∣ v ) E(u∣v)\mathrm{E}(u \mid v) 指的是在 v v vv 固定时 u u uu 的条件期望——也就是说，作为 v v vv 的函数的条件期望——而 E ( u ) E ( u ) E(u)\mathrm{E}(u) 是对 u u uu 的期望，需对 v v vv （以及 u u uu ）进行平均。

Modeling using conditional probability
使用条件概率进行建模

Useful probability models often express the distribution of observables conditionally or hierarchically rather than through more complicated unconditional distributions. For example, suppose y y yy is the height of a university student selected at random. The marginal distribution p ( y ) p ( y ) p(y)p(y) is (essentially) a mixture of two approximately normal distributions centered around 160 and 175 centimeters. A more useful description of the distribution of y y yy would be based on the joint distribution of height and sex: p ( p ( p(p( male ) ≈ p ( ) ≈ p ( )~~p() \approx p( female ) ≈ 1 2 ) ≈ 1 2 )~~(1)/(2)) \approx \frac{1}{2}, along with the conditional specifications that p ( y ∣ p ( y ∣ p(y∣p(y \mid female ) ) )) and p ( y ∣ p ( y ∣ p(y∣p(y \mid male ) ) )) are each approximately normal
有用的概率模型经常通过条件式或分层的方式来表示可观测量的分布，而不是用更复杂的无条件分布。例如，设 y y yy 是随机抽取的一名大学生的身高。边缘分布 p ( y ) p ( y ) p(y)p(y) （实质上）是两个大致以 160 厘米和 175 厘米为中心的正态分布的混合。对 y y yy 的更有用描述是基于身高与性别的联合分布： p ( p ( p(p( 男性 ) ≈ p ( ) ≈ p ( )~~p() \approx p( 女性 ) ≈ 1 2 ) ≈ 1 2 )~~(1)/(2)) \approx \frac{1}{2} ，以及条件规定 p ( y ∣ p ( y ∣ p(y∣p(y \mid 女性 ) ) )) 和 p ( y ∣ p ( y ∣ p(y∣p(y \mid 男性 ) ) )) 各自近似服从正态分布

此电子版仅供非商业用途。

1.8. SOME USEFUL RESULTS FROM PROBABILITY THEORY
1.8. 来自概率论的一些有用结果
with means 160 and 175 cm , respectively. If the conditional variances are not too large, the marginal distribution of y y yy is bimodal. In general, we prefer to model complexity with a hierarchical structure using additional variables rather than with complicated marginal distributions, even when the additional variables are unobserved or even unobservable; this theme underlies mixture models, as discussed in Chapter 22. We repeatedly return to the theme of conditional modeling throughout the book.
均值分别为 160 和 175 厘米。如果条件方差不是太大， y y yy 的边缘分布就是双峰的。一般来说，我们更倾向于通过使用附加变量的分层结构来对复杂性建模，而不是使用复杂的边缘分布，即使这些附加变量是未观测到的甚至不可观测的；这一主题构成了第 22 章讨论的混合模型的基础。我们在全书中反复回到条件建模的主题。

Means and variances of conditional distributions
条件分布的均值和方差

It is often useful to express the mean and variance of a random variable u u uu in terms of the conditional mean and variance given some related quantity v v vv. The mean of u u uu can be obtained by averaging the conditional mean over the marginal distribution of v v vv,
将随机变量 u u uu 的均值和方差用给定某相关量 v v vv 时的条件均值和条件方差来表示，常常是有用的。 u u uu 的均值可以通过对 v v vv 的边缘分布上的条件均值进行平均来获得，
E ( u ) = E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) E ( u ) = E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) E(u)=E(E(u∣v))\mathrm{E}(u)=\mathrm{E}(\mathrm{E}(u \mid v))
where the inner expectation averages over u u uu, conditional on v v vv, and the outer expectation averages over v v vv. Identity (1.8) is easy to derive by writing the expectation in terms of the joint distribution of u u uu and v v vv and then factoring the joint distribution:
其中内层期望是在给定 v v vv 的情况下对 u u uu 进行平均，外层期望是对 v v vv 进行平均。恒等式(1.8)可以通过将期望写成 u u uu 和 v v vv 的联合分布并随后分解该联合分布来容易地推导出来：
E ( u ) = ∬ u p ( u , v ) d u d v = ∬ u p ( u ∣ v ) d u p ( v ) d v = ∫ E ( u ∣ v ) p ( v ) d v E ( u ) = ∬ u p ( u , v ) d u d v = ∬ u p ( u ∣ v ) d u p ( v ) d v = ∫ E ( u ∣ v ) p ( v ) d v E(u)=∬up(u,v)dudv=∬up(u∣v)dup(v)dv=intE(u∣v)p(v)dv\mathrm{E}(u)=\iint u p(u, v) d u d v=\iint u p(u \mid v) d u p(v) d v=\int \mathrm{E}(u \mid v) p(v) d v
The corresponding result for the variance includes two terms, the mean of the conditional variance and the variance of the conditional mean:
对于方差的相应结果包含两项：条件方差的均值和条件均值的方差：
var ( u ) = E ( var ( u ∣ v ) ) + var ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) var ( u ) = E ( var ( u ∣ v ) ) + var ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) var(u)=E(var(u∣v))+var(E(u∣v))\operatorname{var}(u)=\mathrm{E}(\operatorname{var}(u \mid v))+\operatorname{var}(\mathrm{E}(u \mid v))
This result can be derived by expanding the terms on the right side of (1.9):
该结果可以通过展开公式 (1.9) 右边的各项来推导：
E ( var ( u ∣ v ) ) + var ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) = E ( E ( u 2 ∣ v ) − ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 ) + E ( ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 ) − ( E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) ) 2 = E ( u 2 ) − E ( ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 ) + E ( ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 ) − ( E ( u ) ) 2 = E ( u 2 ) − ( E ( u ) ) 2 = var ( u ) E ( var ( u ∣ v ) ) + var ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) = E E u 2 ∣ v − ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 + E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 − ( E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) ) 2 = E u 2 − E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 + E ( E ( u ∣ v ) ) 2 − ( E ( u ) ) 2 = E u 2 − ( E ( u ) ) 2 = var ( u ) {:[E(var(u∣v))+var(E(u∣v))=E(E(u^(2)∣v)-(E(u∣v))^(2))+E((E(u∣v))^(2))-(E(E(u∣v)))^(2)],[=E(u^(2))-E((E(u∣v))^(2))+E((E(u∣v))^(2))-(E(u))^(2)],[=E(u^(2))-(E(u))^(2)],[=var(u)]:}\begin{aligned} \mathrm{E}(\operatorname{var}(u \mid v))+\operatorname{var}(\mathrm{E}(u \mid v)) & =\mathrm{E}\left(\mathrm{E}\left(u^{2} \mid v\right)-(\mathrm{E}(u \mid v))^{2}\right)+\mathrm{E}\left((\mathrm{E}(u \mid v))^{2}\right)-(\mathrm{E}(\mathrm{E}(u \mid v)))^{2} \\ & =\mathrm{E}\left(u^{2}\right)-\mathrm{E}\left((\mathrm{E}(u \mid v))^{2}\right)+\mathrm{E}\left((\mathrm{E}(u \mid v))^{2}\right)-(\mathrm{E}(u))^{2} \\ & =\mathrm{E}\left(u^{2}\right)-(\mathrm{E}(u))^{2} \\ & =\mathrm{var}(u) \end{aligned}
Identities (1.8) and (1.9) also hold if u u uu is a vector, in which case E ( u ) E ( u ) E(u)\mathrm{E}(u) is a vector and var ( u ) var ( u ) var(u)\operatorname{var}(u) a matrix.
等式 (1.8) 和 (1.9) 在 u u uu 为向量的情况下也成立，此时 E ( u ) E ( u ) E(u)\mathrm{E}(u) 为向量而 var ( u ) var ( u ) var(u)\operatorname{var}(u) 为矩阵。

Transformation of variables
变量变换

It is common to transform a probability distribution from one parameterization to another. We review the basic result here for a probability density on a transformed space. For clarity, we use subscripts here instead of our usual generic notation, p ( ⋅ ) p ( ⋅ ) p(*)p(\cdot). Suppose p u ( u ) p u ( u ) p_(u)(u)p_{u}(u) is the density of the vector u u uu, and we transform to v = f ( u ) v = f ( u ) v=f(u)v=f(u), where v v vv has the same number of components as u u uu.
将概率分布从一种参数化变换到另一种参数化是很常见的。这里我们回顾一下针对变换空间上的概率密度的基本结果。为清晰起见，我们在此使用下标而不是通常的通用符号 p ( ⋅ ) p ( ⋅ ) p(*)p(\cdot) 。假设 p u ( u ) p u ( u ) p_(u)(u)p_{u}(u) 是向量 u u uu 的密度，我们将其变换为 v = f ( u ) v = f ( u ) v=f(u)v=f(u) ，其中 v v vv 与 u u uu 具有相同的分量数。
If p u p u p_(u)p_{u} is a discrete distribution, and f f ff is a one-to-one function, then the density of v v vv is given by
如果 p u p u p_(u)p_{u} 是离散分布，且 f f ff 是一对一函数，则 v v vv 的密度由下式给出
p v ( v ) = p u ( f − 1 ( v ) ) . p v ( v ) = p u f − 1 ( v ) . p_(v)(v)=p_(u)(f^(-1)(v)).p_{v}(v)=p_{u}\left(f^{-1}(v)\right) .
If f f ff is a many-to-one function, then a sum of terms appears on the right side of this expression for p v ( v ) p v ( v ) p_(v)(v)p_{v}(v), with one term corresponding to each of the branches of the inverse function.
如果 f f ff 是多对一函数，则此表达式的右侧会出现一项项之和，每一项对应逆函数的一个分支。
If p u p u p_(u)p_{u} is a continuous distribution, and v = f ( u ) v = f ( u ) v=f(u)v=f(u) is a one-to-one transformation, then the joint density of the transformed vector is
如果 p u p u p_(u)p_{u} 是连续分布，且 v = f ( u ) v = f ( u ) v=f(u)v=f(u) 是一对一变换，则变换后向量的联合密度为
p v ( v ) = | J | p u ( f − 1 ( v ) ) p v ( v ) = | J | p u f − 1 ( v ) p_(v)(v)=|J|p_(u)(f^(-1)(v))p_{v}(v)=|J| p_{u}\left(f^{-1}(v)\right)

where | J | | J | |J||J| is the absolute value of the determinant of the Jacobian of the transformation u = f − 1 ( v ) u = f − 1 ( v ) u=f^(-1)(v)u=f^{-1}(v) as a function of v v vv; the Jacobian J J JJ is the square matrix of partial derivatives (with dimension given by the number of components of u u uu ), with the ( i , j ) ( i , j ) (i,j)(i, j) th entry equal to ∂ u i / ∂ v j ∂ u i / ∂ v j delu_(i)//delv_(j)\partial u_{i} / \partial v_{j}. 其中 | J | | J | |J||J| 是作为 v v vv 的函数的变换 u = f − 1 ( v ) u = f − 1 ( v ) u=f^(-1)(v)u=f^{-1}(v) 的雅可比行列式绝对值；雅可比矩阵 J J JJ 是偏导数组成的方阵（维数由 u u uu 的分量数决定），其第 ( i , j ) ( i , j ) (i,j)(i, j) 个条目等于 ∂ u i / ∂ v j ∂ u i / ∂ v j delu_(i)//delv_(j)\partial u_{i} / \partial v_{j} 。同样地，如果 f f ff 是多对一的，则 p v ( v ) p v ( v ) p_(v)(v)p_{v}(v) 为若干项的和或积分。
In one dimension, we commonly use the logarithm to transform the parameter space from ( 0 , ∞ ) ( 0 , ∞ ) (0,oo)(0, \infty) to ( − ∞ , ∞ ) ( − ∞ , ∞ ) (-oo,oo)(-\infty, \infty). When working with parameters defined on the open unit interval, ( 0 , 1 ) ( 0 , 1 ) (0,1)(0,1), we often use the logistic transformation:
在一维情况下，我们常用对数将参数空间从 ( 0 , ∞ ) ( 0 , ∞ ) (0,oo)(0, \infty) 变换到 ( − ∞ , ∞ ) ( − ∞ , ∞ ) (-oo,oo)(-\infty, \infty) 。当处理定义在开单位区间 ( 0 , 1 ) ( 0 , 1 ) (0,1)(0,1) 上的参数时，我们经常使用逻辑变换：
logit ( u ) = log ⁡ ( u 1 − u ) logit ( u ) = log ⁡ u 1 − u logit(u)=log((u)/(1-u))\operatorname{logit}(u)=\log \left(\frac{u}{1-u}\right)
whose inverse transformation is

logit − 1 ( v ) = e v 1 + e v logit − 1 ( v ) = e v 1 + e v logit^(-1)(v)=(e^(v))/(1+e^(v))\operatorname{logit}^{-1}(v)=\frac{e^{v}}{1+e^{v}}
Another common choice is the probit transformation, Φ − 1 ( u ) Φ − 1 ( u ) Phi^(-1)(u)\Phi^{-1}(u), where Φ Φ Phi\Phi is the standard normal cumulative distribution function, to transform from ( 0 , 1 ) ( 0 , 1 ) (0,1)(0,1) to ( − ∞ , ∞ ) ( − ∞ , ∞ ) (-oo,oo)(-\infty, \infty).
另一种常见的选择是 probit 变换， Φ − 1 ( u ) Φ − 1 ( u ) Phi^(-1)(u)\Phi^{-1}(u) ，其中 Φ Φ Phi\Phi 是标准正态分布函数，用于将 ( 0 , 1 ) ( 0 , 1 ) (0,1)(0,1) 转换为 ( − ∞ , ∞ ) ( − ∞ , ∞ ) (-oo,oo)(-\infty, \infty) 。

1.9 Computation and software
1.9 计算与软件

At the time of writing, the authors rely primarily on the software package R R RR for graphs and basic simulations, fitting of classical simple models (including regression, generalized linear models, and nonparametric methods such as locally weighted regression), optimization, and some simple programming. We use the Bayesian inference package Stan (see Appendix C) for fitting most models, but for teaching purposes in this book we describe how to perform most of the computations from first principles. Even when using Stan, we typically work within R to plot and transform the data before model fitting, and to display inferences and model checks afterwards.
在撰写本书时，作者主要依靠软件包 R R RR 来绘图和基本模拟、拟合经典的简单模型（包括回归、广义线性模型以及诸如局部加权回归等非参数方法）、优化以及一些简单编程。我们使用贝叶斯推断软件包 Stan（见附录 C）来拟合大多数模型，但为了教学目的，本书描述了如何从基本原理执行大部分计算。即使使用 Stan，我们通常也在 R 中处理，在模型拟合前绘图和变换数据，之后展示推断结果和模型检验。
Specific computational tasks that arise in Bayesian data analysis include:
贝叶斯数据分析中出现的具体计算任务包括：
  • Vector and matrix manipulations (see Table 1.1)
    向量和矩阵运算（见表 1.1）
  • Computing probability density functions (see Appendix A)
    计算概率密度函数（见附录 A）
  • Drawing simulations from probability distributions (see Appendix A for standard distributions and Exercise 1.9 for an example of a simple stochastic process)
    从概率分布中抽取模拟样本（标准分布见附录 A，简单随机过程的例子见练习 1.9）
  • Structured programming (including looping and customized functions)
    结构化编程（包括循环和自定义函数）
  • Calculating the linear regression estimate and variance matrix (see Chapter 14)
    计算线性回归的估计值和方差矩阵（见第 14 章）
  • Graphics, including scatterplots with overlain lines and multiple graphs per page (see Chapter 6 for examples).
    图形，包括带有叠加直线的散点图和每页多图显示（示例见第 6 章）。
    Our general approach to computation is to fit many models, gradually increasing the complexity. We do not recommend the strategy of writing a model and then letting the computer run overnight to estimate it perfectly. Rather, we prefer to fit each model relatively quickly, using inferences from the previously fitted simpler models as starting values, and displaying inferences and comparing to data before continuing.
    我们的一般计算方法是拟合许多模型，逐步增加复杂度。我们不推荐那种写好一个模型然后让计算机整夜运行以期得到完美估计的策略。相反，我们更倾向于相对快速地拟合每个模型，使用先前较简单模型的推断作为起始值，在继续之前展示推断结果并与数据进行比较。
We discuss computation in detail in Part III of this book after first introducing the fundamental concepts of Bayesian modeling, inference, and model checking. Appendix C illustrates how to perform computations in R and Stan in several different ways for a single example.
在本书第三部分中，我们在先介绍贝叶斯建模、推断和模型检验的基本概念之后，详细讨论计算。附录 C 展示了如何针对单个示例以多种不同方式在 R 和 Stan 中执行计算。

Summarizing inferences by simulation
通过模拟概括推断

Simulation forms a central part of much applied Bayesian analysis, because of the relative ease with which samples can often be generated from a probability distribution, even when
模拟构成了大量应用贝叶斯分析的核心部分，因为通常可以相对容易地从概率分布中生成样本，即使在

1.9. COMPUTATION AND SOFTWARE
1.9. 计算与软件

the density function cannot be explicitly integrated. In performing simulations, it is helpful to consider the duality between a probability density function and a histogram of a set of random draws from the distribution: given a large enough sample, the histogram can provide practically complete information about the density, and in particular, various sample moments, percentiles, and other summary statistics provide estimates of any aspect of the distribution, to a level of precision that can be estimated. For example, to estimate the 95th percentile of the distribution of θ θ theta\theta, draw a random sample of size S S SS from p ( θ ) p ( θ ) p(theta)p(\theta) and use the 0.95 S 0.95 S 0.95 S0.95 S th order statistic. For most purposes, S = 1000 S = 1000 S=1000S=1000 is adequate for estimating the 95th percentile in this way.
当密度函数无法显式积分时，进行模拟时考虑概率密度函数与一组来自该分布的随机抽样直方图之间的对应关系是有帮助的：在样本足够大时，直方图可以在实践上完整地反映密度的信息，特别地，各种样本矩、分位数和其他汇总统计量可以估计分布的任何方面，其精度可以被估算。例如，要估计分布 θ θ theta\theta 的第 95 百分位数，可以从 p ( θ ) p ( θ ) p(theta)p(\theta) 中抽取大小为 S S SS 的随机样本，并使用第 0.95 S 0.95 S 0.95 S0.95 S 个次序统计量。在大多数情况下， S = 1000 S = 1000 S=1000S=1000 对于以这种方式估计第 95 百分位数是足够的。
Another advantage of simulation is that extremely large or small simulated values often flag a problem with model specification or parameterization (for example, see Figure 4.2) that might not be noticed if estimates and probability statements were obtained in analytic form.
模拟的另一个优点是，极大或极小的模拟值常常能提示模型指定或参数化存在问题（例如，参见图 4.2），而如果以解析形式获得估计和概率陈述，这类问题可能不会被注意到。
Generating values from a probability distribution is often straightforward with modern computing techniques based on (pseudo)random number sequences. A well-designed pseudorandom number generator yields a deterministic sequence that appears to have the same properties as a sequence of independent random draws from the uniform distribution on [ 0 , 1 ] [ 0 , 1 ] [0,1][0,1]. Appendix A describes methods for drawing random samples from some commonly used distributions.
使用基于（伪）随机数序列的现代计算技术从概率分布中生成数值通常很简单。设计良好的伪随机数生成器会产生一个确定性的序列，该序列看起来具有与从区间[0,1]上的均匀分布独立抽样序列相同的性质。附录 A 介绍了从一些常用分布中抽取随机样本的方法。

Sampling using the inverse cumulative distribution function
使用逆累积分布函数进行抽样

As an introduction to the ideas of simulation, we describe a method for sampling from discrete and continuous distributions using the inverse cumulative distribution function. The cumulative distribution function, or c d f , F c d f , F cdf,Fc d f, F, of a one-dimensional distribution, p ( v ) p ( v ) p(v)p(v), is defined by

F ( v ∗ ) = Pr ( v ≤ v ∗ ) = { ∑ v ≤ v ∗ p ( v ) if p is discrete ∫ − ∞ v ∗ p ( v ) d v if p is continuous. "]:}]:}\begin{aligned} F\left(v_{*}\right) & =\operatorname{Pr}\left(v \leq v_{*}\right) \\ & = \begin{cases}\sum_{v \leq v_{*}} p(v) & \text { if } p \text { is discrete } \\ \int_{-\infty}^{v_{*}} p(v) d v & \text { if } p \text { is continuous. }\end{cases} \end{aligned}
The inverse cdf can be used to obtain random samples from the distribution p p pp, as follows. First draw a random value, U U UU, from the uniform distribution on [ 0 , 1 ] [ 0 , 1 ] [0,1][0,1], using a table of random numbers or, more likely, a random number function on the computer. Now let v = F − 1 ( U ) v = F − 1 ( U ) v=F^(-1)(U)v=F^{-1}(U). The function F F FF is not necessarily one-to-one - certainly not if the distribution is discrete - but F − 1 ( U ) F − 1 ( U ) F^(-1)(U)F^{-1}(U) is unique with probability 1 . The value v v vv will be a random draw from p p pp, and is easy to compute as long as F − 1 ( U ) F − 1 ( U ) F^(-1)(U)F^{-1}(U) is simple. For a discrete distribution, F − 1 F − 1 F^(-1)F^{-1} can simply be tabulated.
反函数分布函数可用于从分布 p p pp 中获取随机样本，方法如下。首先从区间 [ 0 , 1 ] [ 0 , 1 ] [0,1][0,1] 上的均匀分布中抽取一个随机值 U U UU ，可使用随机数表，或更常见地使用计算机上的随机数函数。现在令 v = F − 1 ( U ) v = F − 1 ( U ) v=F^(-1)(U)v=F^{-1}(U) 。函数 F F FF 不一定是一一对应的——如果分布是离散的就肯定不是——但 F − 1 ( U ) F − 1 ( U ) F^(-1)(U)F^{-1}(U) 以概率 1 是唯一的。值 v v vv 将是从 p p pp 中随机抽取的样本，并且只要 F − 1 ( U ) F − 1 ( U ) F^(-1)(U)F^{-1}(U) 简单就很容易计算。对于离散分布， F − 1 F − 1 F^(-1)F^{-1} 可以简单地列成表格。

1.10 Bayesian inference in applied statistics
1.10 应用统计学中的贝叶斯推断

A pragmatic rationale for the use of Bayesian methods is the inherent flexibility introduced by their incorporation of multiple levels of randomness and the resultant ability to combine information from different sources, while incorporating all reasonable sources of uncertainty in inferential summaries. Such methods naturally lead to smoothed estimates in complicated data structures and consequently have the ability to obtain better real-world answers.
使用贝叶斯方法的务实理由在于其通过引入多层随机性所带来的固有灵活性，以及由此能够结合来自不同来源的信息，同时在推断性摘要中考虑所有合理的不确定性来源。这类方法在复杂数据结构中自然会产生平滑化的估计，因此有能力获得更符合现实的答案。
Another reason for focusing on Bayesian methods is more psychological, and involves the relationship between the statistician and the client or specialist in the subject matter area who is the consumer of the statistician’s work. In many practical cases, clients will interpret interval estimates provided by statisticians as Bayesian intervals, that is, as probability statements about the likely values of unknown quantities conditional on the evidence in the data. Such direct probability statements require prior probability specifications for unknown quantities (or more generally, probability models for vectors of unknowns), and thus the kinds of answers clients will assume are being provided by statisticians, Bayesian answers, require full probability models - explicit or implicit.
关注贝叶斯方法的另一个原因更偏向心理层面，涉及统计学家与客户或该学科领域专家之间的关系——后者是统计学家工作成果的使用者。在许多实际情况下，客户会将统计学家提供的区间估计解释为贝叶斯区间，即作为关于在观测数据证据条件下未知量可能取值的概率陈述。这类直接的概率陈述需要对未知量（或更一般地，对未知量向量）给出先验概率的规定，因此，客户所认为统计学家提供的答案——贝叶斯式的答案——需要完整的概率模型，无论是显式的还是隐式的。
Finally, Bayesian inferences are conditional on probability models that invariably contain approximations in their attempt to represent complicated real-world relationships. If the Bayesian answers vary dramatically over a range of scientifically reasonable assumptions that are unassailable by the data, then the resultant range of possible conclusions must be entertained as legitimate, and we believe that the statistician has the responsibility to make the client aware of this fact.
最后，贝叶斯推断以概率模型为条件，这些模型在试图表示复杂的现实关系时不可避免地包含近似。如果在一系列科学上合理且数据无法否定的假设下，贝叶斯结论出现巨大的差异，那么由此产生的一系列可能结论都必须被视为合理的，我们认为统计学家有责任让客户意识到这一点。
In this book, we focus on the construction of models (especially hierarchical ones, as discussed in Chapter 5 onward) to relate complicated data structures to scientific questions, checking the fit of such models, and investigating the sensitivity of conclusions to reasonable modeling assumptions. From this point of view, the strength of the Bayesian approach lies in (1) its ability to combine information from multiple sources (thereby in fact allowing greater ‘objectivity’ in final conclusions), and (2) its more encompassing accounting of uncertainty about the unknowns in a statistical problem.
在本书中，我们侧重于构建模型（尤其是第 5 章起讨论的分层模型）以将复杂的数据结构与科学问题联系起来，检验此类模型的拟合情况，并研究结论对合理建模假设的敏感性。从这一观点看，贝叶斯方法的优势在于：(1) 它能够结合多来源信息（从而实际上使最终结论更具“客观性”），以及 (2) 它对统计问题中未知数的不确定性有更全面的考量。

This electronic edition is for non-commercial purposes only.
本电子版仅供非商业用途。

1.11. BIBLIOGRAPHIC NOTE
1.11. 参考文献注释

Other important themes, many of which are common to much modern applied statistical practice, whether formally Bayesian or not, are the following:
其他重要主题，其中许多在现代应用统计实践中都很常见，无论是否形式上属于贝叶斯方法，以下几点尤为重要：
  • a willingness to use many parameters
    愿意使用大量参数
  • hierarchical structuring of models, which is the essential tool for achieving partial pooling of estimates and compromising in a scientific way between alternative sources of information
    模型的分层结构，这是实现估计的部分汇总（partial pooling）并以科学方式在不同信息来源之间达成折衷的核心工具
  • model checking-not only by examining the internal goodness of fit of models to observed and possible future data, but also by comparing inferences about estimands and predictions of interest to substantive knowledge
    模型检验——不仅通过检查模型对已观测数据和可能的未来数据的内部拟合度，还要通过将关于感兴趣的估计量的推断和预测与实质性知识进行比较
  • an emphasis on inference in the form of distributions or at least interval estimates rather than simple point estimates
    强调以分布形式或至少以区间估计来进行推断，而不是仅给出简单的点估计
  • the use of simulation as the primary method of computation; the modern computational counterpart to a ‘joint probability distribution’ is a set of randomly drawn values, and a key tool for dealing with missing data is the method of multiple imputation (computation and multiple imputation are discussed in more detail in later chapters)
    以模拟作为主要计算方法；“联合概率分布”在现代计算中的对应物是一组随机抽取的数值，处理缺失数据的关键工具是多重插补法（计算和多重插补将在后续章节详细讨论）
  • the use of probability models as tools for understanding and possibly improving dataanalytic techniques that may not explicitly invoke a Bayesian model
    将概率模型作为理解并可能改进那些未必明确采用贝叶斯模型的数据分析技术的工具
  • the importance of including in the analysis as much background information as possible, so as to approximate the goal that data can be viewed as a random sample, conditional on all the variables in the model
    在分析中尽可能包含所有背景信息的重要性，以便尽量接近这样的目标：在模型中所含所有变量的条件下，将数据视为随机样本
  • the importance of designing studies to have the property that inferences for estimands of interest will be robust to model assumptions.
    设计研究时应重视使对感兴趣估计量的推断能对模型假设保持稳健这一特性。

1.11 Bibliographic note  1.11 参考书目说明

Several good introductory books have been written on Bayesian statistics, beginning with Lindley (1965), and continuing through Hoff (2009). Berry (1996) presents, from a Bayesian perspective, many of the standard topics for an introductory statistics textbook. Gill (2002) and Jackman (2009) introduce applied Bayesian statistics for social scientists, Kruschke (2011) introduces Bayesian methods for psychology researchers, and Christensen et al. (2010) supply a general introduction. Carlin and Louis (2008) cover the theory and applications of Bayesian inference, focusing on biological applications and connections to classical methods. Some resources for teaching Bayesian statistics include Sedlmeier and Gigerenzer (2001) and Gelman (1998, 2008b).
已有多本优秀的贝叶斯统计学入门书籍，自 Lindley (1965) 开始，随后有 Hoff (2009)。Berry (1996) 从贝叶斯视角呈现了许多入门统计教材的标准主题。Gill (2002) 和 Jackman (2009) 为社会科学家介绍了应用贝叶斯统计，Kruschke (2011) 为心理学研究者介绍了贝叶斯方法，Christensen 等人 (2010) 提供了一般性的入门。Carlin 和 Louis (2008) 涵盖了贝叶斯推断的理论与应用，侧重生物学应用并与经典方法建立联系。一些用于教授贝叶斯统计的资源包括 Sedlmeier 和 Gigerenzer (2001) 以及 Gelman (1998, 2008b)。
The bibliographic notes at the ends of the chapters in this book refer to a variety of specific applications of Bayesian data analysis. Several review articles in the statistical literature, such as Breslow (1990) and Racine et al. (1986), have appeared that discuss, in general terms, areas of application in which Bayesian methods have been useful. The volumes edited by Gatsonis et al. (1993-2002) are collections of Bayesian analyses, including extensive discussions about choices in the modeling process and the relations between the statistical methods and the applications.
本书各章末的参考书目提到了贝叶斯数据分析在多种具体应用中的案例。统计学文献中出现过几篇综述性文章，例如 Breslow (1990) 和 Racine et al. (1986)，大体上讨论了贝叶斯方法在若干应用领域中何以有用。Gatsonis 等人编辑的丛书（1993–2002）则是贝叶斯分析的汇编，其中包括关于建模过程中各类选择的详尽讨论，以及统计方法与具体应用之间的关系。
The foundations of probability and Bayesian statistics are an important topic that we treat only briefly. Bernardo and Smith (1994) give a thorough review of the foundations of Bayesian models and inference with a comprehensive list of references. Jeffreys (1961) is a self-contained book about Bayesian statistics that comprehensively presents an inductive view of inference; Good (1950) is another important early work. Jaynes (1983) is a collection of reprinted articles that present a deductive view of Bayesian inference that we believe is similar to ours. Both Jeffreys and Jaynes focus on applications in the physical sciences. Jaynes (2003) focuses on connections between statistical inference and the philosophy of science and includes several examples of physical probability.
概率论与贝叶斯统计的基础是一个重要的话题，但我们这里只做简要论述。Bernardo 和 Smith (1994) 对贝叶斯模型与推断的基础进行了全面回顾，并附有详尽的参考文献清单。Jeffreys (1961) 是一本自成体系的贝叶斯统计学著作，全面阐述了归纳式的推断观点；Good (1950) 则是另一部重要的早期著作。Jaynes (1983) 是一部重印文章的合集，提出了与我们相似的演绎式贝叶斯推断观点。Jeffreys 和 Jaynes 都侧重于物理科学中的应用。Jaynes (2003) 则着重于统计推断与科学哲学之间的联系，并包含了若干关于物理概率的例子。

This electronic edition is for non-commercial purposes only.
本电子版仅供非商业用途。

1. PROBABILITY AND INFERENCE
1. 概率与推断

Gigerenzer and Hoffrage (1995) discuss the connections between Bayesian probability and frequency probabilities from a perspective similar to ours, and provide evidence that people can typically understand and compute best with probabilities that are expressed in the form of relative frequency. Gelman (1998) presents some classroom activities for teaching Bayesian ideas.
Gigerenzer 和 Hoffrage（1995）从与我们类似的角度讨论了贝叶斯概率与频率概率之间的联系，并提供证据表明人们通常在以相对频率形式表达的概率上理解和计算得最好。Gelman（1998）提出了一些用于教授贝叶斯思想的课堂活动。
De Finetti (1974) is an influential work that focuses on the crucial role of exchangeability. More approachable discussions of the role of exchangeability in Bayesian inference are provided by Lindley and Novick (1981) and Rubin (1978a, 1987a). The non-Bayesian article by Draper et al. (1993) makes an interesting attempt to explain how exchangeable probability models can be justified in data analysis. Berger and Wolpert (1984) give a comprehensive discussion and review of the likelihood principle, and Berger (1985, Sections 1.6, 4.1, and 4.12) reviews a range of philosophical issues from the perspective of Bayesian decision theory.
De Finetti（1974）是一部具有影响力的著作，重点关注可交换性的关键作用。Lindley 和 Novick（1981）以及 Rubin（1978a，1987a）提供了关于可交换性在贝叶斯推断中作用的更易理解的讨论。Draper 等人（1993）的非贝叶斯文章有趣地尝试解释在数据分析中如何为可交换的概率模型提供正当性。Berger 和 Wolpert（1984）对似然原则进行了全面讨论和综述，Berger（1985，第 1.6、4.1 和 4.12 节）则从贝叶斯决策理论的角度回顾了一系列哲学问题。
Our own philosophy of Bayesian statistics appears in Gelman (2011) and Gelman and Shalizi (2013); for some contrasting views, see the discussion of that article, along with Efron (1986) and the discussions following Gelman (2008a).
我们的贝叶斯统计学哲学见于 Gelman (2011) 和 Gelman 和 Shalizi (2013)；关于一些不同的观点，请参见该文章的讨论，以及 Efron (1986) 和 Gelman (2008a) 之后的讨论。
Pratt (1965) and Rubin (1984) discuss the relevance of Bayesian methods for applied statistics and make many connections between Bayesian and non-Bayesian approaches to inference. Further references on the foundations of statistical inference appear in Shafer (1982) and the accompanying discussion. Kahneman and Tversky (1972) and Alpert and Raiffa (1982) present the results of psychological experiments that assess the meaning of ‘subjective probability’ as measured by people’s stated beliefs and observed actions. Lindley (1971a) surveys many different statistical ideas, all from the Bayesian perspective. Box and Tiao (1973) is an early book on applied Bayesian methods. They give an extensive treatment of inference based on normal distributions, and their first chapter, a broad introduction to Bayesian inference, provides a good counterpart to Chapters 1 and 2 of this book.
Pratt (1965) 和 Rubin (1984) 讨论了贝叶斯方法在应用统计学中的相关性，并在贝叶斯与非贝叶斯推断方法之间建立了许多联系。关于统计推断基础的进一步参考文献见 Shafer (1982) 及其附带讨论。Kahneman 和 Tversky (1972) 以及 Alpert 和 Raiffa (1982) 展示了心理学实验的结果，这些实验评估了通过人们陈述的信念和观察到的行为来度量的“主观概率”的含义。Lindley (1971a) 从贝叶斯视角回顾了许多不同的统计思想。Box 和 Tiao (1973) 是一本关于应用贝叶斯方法的早期著作。他们对基于正态分布的推断进行了广泛论述，其第一章对贝叶斯推断的广泛介绍可作为本书第 1 章和第 2 章的良好对应补充。
The iterative process involving modeling, inference, and model checking that we present in Section 1.1 is discussed at length in the first chapter of Box and Tiao (1973) and also in Box (1980). Cox and Snell (1981) provide a more introductory treatment of these ideas from a less model-based perspective.
我们在第 1.1 节中提出的涉及建模、推断与模型检验的迭代过程，在 Box 和 Tiao (1973) 的第一章以及 Box (1980) 中有详细讨论。Cox 和 Snell (1981) 以较少依赖模型的视角对这些思想提供了更入门的论述。
Many good books on the mathematical aspects of probability theory are available, such as Feller (1968) and Ross (1983); these are useful when constructing probability models and working with them. O’Hagan (1988) has written an interesting introductory text on probability from an explicitly Bayesian point of view.
有许多关于概率论数学方面的优秀书籍可供参考，例如 Feller (1968) 和 Ross (1983)；在构建概率模型和处理模型时这些书很有用。O’Hagan (1988) 从明确的贝叶斯视角写了一本有趣的概率入门教材。
Physical probability models for coin tossing are discussed by Keller (1986), Jaynes (2003), and Gelman and Nolan (2002b). The football example of Section 1.6 is discussed in more detail in Stern (1991); see also Harville (1980) and Glickman (1993) and Glickman and Stern (1998) for analyses of football scores not using the point spread. Related analyses of sports scores and betting odds appear in Stern (1997, 1998). For more background on sports betting, see Snyder (1975) and Rombola (1984).
关于掷硬币的物理概率模型可参见 Keller (1986)、Jaynes (2003) 和 Gelman 与 Nolan (2002b)。第 1.6 节的橄榄球示例在 Stern (1991) 中有更详细的讨论；另见 Harville (1980) 和 Glickman (1993) 以及 Glickman 与 Stern (1998) 对不使用让分的橄榄球得分的分析。与体育比赛得分和投注赔率相关的分析出现在 Stern (1997, 1998)。有关体育博彩的更多背景资料，请参见 Snyder (1975) 和 Rombola (1984)。
An interesting real-world example of probability assignment arose with the explosion of the Challenger space shuttle in 1986; Martz and Zimmer (1992), Dalal, Fowlkes, and Hoadley (1989), and Lavine (1991) present and compare various methods for assigning probabilities for space shuttle failures. (At the time of writing we are not aware of similar contributions relating to the more recent space accident in 2003.) The record-linkage example in Section 1.7 appears in Belin and Rubin (1995b), who discuss the mixture models and calibration techniques in more detail. The Census problem that motivated the record linkage is described by Hogan (1992).
一个有趣的现实世界概率指派例子是 1986 年挑战者号航天飞机爆炸事件；Martz 和 Zimmer (1992)、Dalal、Fowlkes 和 Hoadley (1989)、以及 Lavine (1991) 提出并比较了用于指派航天飞机失效概率的各种方法。（在撰写时，我们尚未发现关于 2003 年更近期航天事故的类似研究。）第 1.7 节中的记录匹配示例见 Belin 和 Rubin (1995b)，他们更详细地讨论了混合模型和校准技术。激发记录匹配问题的普查问题由 Hogan (1992) 描述。
In all our examples, probabilities are assigned using statistical modeling and estimation, not by ‘subjective’ assessment. Dawid (1986) provides a general discussion of probability assignment, and Dawid (1982) discusses the connections between calibration and Bayesian probability assignment.
在我们所有的示例中，概率都是通过统计建模和估计来指派的，而不是通过“主观”评估。Dawid (1986) 提供了关于概率指派的一般讨论，Dawid (1982) 讨论了校准与贝叶斯概率指派之间的联系。

This electronic edition is for non-commercial purposes only.
本电子版仅供非商业用途。

1.12. EXERCISES  1.12. 练习

The graphical method of jittering, used in Figures 1.1 and 1.2 and elsewhere in this book, is discussed in Chambers et al. (1983). For information on the statistical packages R and Bugs, see Becker, Chambers, and Wilks (1988), R Project (2002), Fox (2002), Venables and Ripley (2002), and Spiegelhalter et al. (1994, 2003).
用于抖动的图形方法，见本书中图 1.1 和图 1.2 及其他处，Chambers 等人 (1983) 对此有讨论。有关统计软件包 R 和 Bugs 的信息，请参见 Becker、Chambers 和 Wilks (1988)、R Project (2002)、Fox (2002)、Venables 和 Ripley (2002) 以及 Spiegelhalter 等人 (1994, 2003)。
Norvig (2007) describes the principles and details of the Bayesian spelling corrector.
Norvig (2007) 描述了贝叶斯拼写校正器的原理和细节。

  1. Conditional probability: suppose that if θ = 1 θ = 1 theta=1\theta=1, then y y yy has a normal distribution with mean 1 and standard deviation σ σ sigma\sigma, and if θ = 2 θ = 2 theta=2\theta=2, then y y yy has a normal distribution with mean 2 and standard deviation σ σ sigma\sigma. Also, suppose Pr ( θ = 1 ) = 0.5 Pr ( θ = 1 ) = 0.5 Pr(theta=1)=0.5\operatorname{Pr}(\theta=1)=0.5 and Pr ( θ = 2 ) = 0.5 Pr ( θ = 2 ) = 0.5 Pr(theta=2)=0.5\operatorname{Pr}(\theta=2)=0.5.
    条件概率：假设如果 θ = 1 θ = 1 theta=1\theta=1 ，那么 y y yy 服从均值为 1、标准差为 σ σ sigma\sigma 的正态分布；如果 θ = 2 θ = 2 theta=2\theta=2 ，那么 y y yy 服从均值为 2、标准差为 σ σ sigma\sigma 的正态分布。另外，假设 Pr ( θ = 1 ) = 0.5 Pr ( θ = 1 ) = 0.5 Pr(theta=1)=0.5\operatorname{Pr}(\theta=1)=0.5 和 Pr ( θ = 2 ) = 0.5 Pr ( θ = 2 ) = 0.5 Pr(theta=2)=0.5\operatorname{Pr}(\theta=2)=0.5 。
    (a) For σ = 2 σ = 2 sigma=2\sigma=2, write the formula for the marginal probability density for y y yy and sketch it.
    (a) 对于 σ = 2 σ = 2 sigma=2\sigma=2 ，写出 y y yy 的边缘概率密度的公式并画出其草图。
    (b) What is Pr ( θ = 1 ∣ y = 1 ) Pr ( θ = 1 ∣ y = 1 ) Pr(theta=1∣y=1)\operatorname{Pr}(\theta=1 \mid y=1), again supposing σ = 2 σ = 2 sigma=2\sigma=2 ?

  2. Conditional means and variances: show that (1.8) and (1.9) hold if u u uu is a vector.
    条件均值和方差：证明当 u u uu 为向量时，(1.8) 和 (1.9) 仍然成立。
  3. Probability calculation for genetics (from Lindley, 1965): suppose that in each individual of a large population there is a pair of genes, each of which can be either x or X , that controls eye color: those with xx have blue eyes, while heterozygotes (those with Xx or xX ) and those with XX have brown eyes. The proportion of blue-eyed individuals is p 2 p 2 p^(2)p^{2} and of heterozygotes is 2 p ( 1 − p ) 2 p ( 1 − p ) 2p(1-p)2 p(1-p), where 0 < p < 1 0 < p < 1 0 < p < 10<p<1. Each parent transmits one of its own genes to the child; if a parent is a heterozygote, the probability that it transmits the gene of type X is 1 2 1 2 (1)/(2)\frac{1}{2}. Assuming random mating, show that among brown-eyed children of brown-eyed parents, the expected proportion of heterozygotes is 2 p / ( 1 + 2 p ) 2 p / ( 1 + 2 p ) 2p//(1+2p)2 p /(1+2 p). Suppose Judy, a brown-eyed child of brown-eyed parents, marries a heterozygote, and they have n n nn children, all brown-eyed. Find the posterior probability that Judy is a heterozygote and the probability that her first grandchild has blue eyes.
    遗传学的概率计算（摘自 Lindley，1965）：假设在一个大种群的每个个体中都有一对基因，每个基因可以是 x 或 X ，控制眼睛颜色：基因型为 xx 的人有蓝眼睛，而杂合子（基因型为 Xx 或 xX）和基因型为 XX 的人有棕色眼睛。蓝眼睛个体的比例为 p 2 p 2 p^(2)p^{2} ，杂合子的比例为 2 p ( 1 − p ) 2 p ( 1 − p ) 2p(1-p)2 p(1-p) ，其中 0 < p < 1 0 < p < 1 0 < p < 10<p<1 。每个父母将其自身的一种基因传给孩子；如果父母是杂合子，则其传递 X 型基因的概率为 1 2 1 2 (1)/(2)\frac{1}{2} 。假设随机交配，证明在棕色眼睛父母的棕色眼睛子女中，杂合子的期望比例为 2 p / ( 1 + 2 p ) 2 p / ( 1 + 2 p ) 2p//(1+2p)2 p /(1+2 p) 。假设 Judy（裘蒂）是棕色眼睛且父母均为棕色眼睛，她嫁给了一位杂合子，并且他们有 n n nn 个孩子，且所有孩子均为棕色眼睛。求裘蒂为杂合子的后验概率以及她第一个孙子（孙女）有蓝眼睛的概率。
  4. Probability assignment: we will use the football dataset to estimate some conditional probabilities about professional football games. There were twelve games with point spreads of 8 points; the outcomes in those games were: − 7 , − 5 , − 3 , − 3 , 1 , 6 , 7 , 13 , 15 − 7 , − 5 , − 3 , − 3 , 1 , 6 , 7 , 13 , 15 -7,-5,-3,-3,1,6,7,13,15-7,-5,-3,-3,1,6,7,13,15, 16, 20, and 21, with positive values indicating wins by the favorite and negative values indicating wins by the underdog. Consider the following conditional probabilities:
    概率赋值：我们将使用橄榄球数据集来估计一些关于职业橄榄球比赛的条件概率。有十二场比赛的让分为 8 分；这些比赛的结果为： − 7 , − 5 , − 3 , − 3 , 1 , 6 , 7 , 13 , 15 − 7 , − 5 , − 3 , − 3 , 1 , 6 , 7 , 13 , 15 -7,-5,-3,-3,1,6,7,13,15-7,-5,-3,-3,1,6,7,13,15 、16、20 和 21，正值表示由让分方获胜，负值表示由受让方获胜。考虑以下条件概率：
Pr ( favorite wins ∣ point spread = 8 ) , Pr ( favorite wins by at least 8 ∣ point spread = 8 ) , Pr ( favorite wins by at least 8 ∣ point spread = 8 and favorite wins ) . Pr (  favorite wins  ∣  point spread  = 8 ) , Pr (  favorite wins by at least  8 ∣  point spread  = 8 ) , Pr (  favorite wins by at least  8 ∣  point spread  = 8  and favorite wins  ) . {:[Pr(" favorite wins "∣" point spread "=8)","],[Pr(" favorite wins by at least "8∣" point spread "=8)","],[Pr(" favorite wins by at least "8∣" point spread "=8" and favorite wins ").]:}\begin{aligned} & \operatorname{Pr}(\text { favorite wins } \mid \text { point spread }=8), \\ & \operatorname{Pr}(\text { favorite wins by at least } 8 \mid \text { point spread }=8), \\ & \operatorname{Pr}(\text { favorite wins by at least } 8 \mid \text { point spread }=8 \text { and favorite wins }) . \end{aligned}
(a) Estimate each of these using the relative frequencies of games with a point spread of 8.
(a) 使用让分为 8 分的比赛的相对频率估计每一个概率。
(b) Estimate each using the normal approximation for the distribution of (outcome point spread).
(b) 使用（比赛结果让分）分布的正态近似来估计每一个概率。
5. Probability assignment: the 435 U.S. Congressmembers are elected to two-year terms; the number of voters in an individual congressional election varies from about 50,000 to 350,000 . We will use various sources of information to estimate roughly the probability that at least one congressional election is tied in the next national election.
5. 概率赋值：美国国会的 435 名议员任期为两年；单次国会选举的投票人数大约在 5 万到 35 万之间。我们将使用各种信息来源粗略估计在下一次全国选举中至少有一次国会选举出现平局的概率。
(a) Use any knowledge you have about U.S. politics. Specify clearly what information you are using to construct this conditional probability, even if your answer is just a guess.
(a) 利用你对美国政治的任何知识。明确说明你用来构建该条件概率的信息，即使你的答案只是一个猜测。
(b) Use the following information: in the period 1900-1992, there were 20,597 congressional elections, out of which 6 were decided by fewer than 10 votes and 49 decided by fewer than 100 votes.
(b) 使用以下信息：在 1900–1992 年期间，共有 20,597 次国会选举，其中有 6 次以少于 10 票决定，49 次以少于 100 票决定。

本电子版仅供非商业用途。

See Gelman, King, and Boscardin (1998), Mulligan and Hunter (2001), and Gelman, Katz, and Tuerlinckx (2002) for more on this topic.
有关该主题的更多内容，请参见 Gelman、King 与 Boscardin（1998）、Mulligan 与 Hunter（2001）、以及 Gelman、Katz 与 Tuerlinckx（2002）。
6. Conditional probability: approximately 1 / 125 1 / 125 1//1251 / 125 of all births are fraternal twins and 1 / 300 1 / 300 1//3001 / 300 of births are identical twins. Elvis Presley had a twin brother (who died at birth). What is the probability that Elvis was an identical twin? (You may approximate the probability of a boy or girl birth as 1 2 1 2 (1)/(2)\frac{1}{2}.)
6. 条件概率：大约 1 / 125 1 / 125 1//1251 / 125 的出生是异卵双胞胎， 1 / 300 1 / 300 1//3001 / 300 的出生是同卵双胞胎。埃尔维斯·普雷斯利有一个双胞胎兄弟（出生时夭折）。埃尔维斯是同卵双胞胎的概率是多少？（你可以将男孩或女孩出生的概率近似为 1 2 1 2 (1)/(2)\frac{1}{2} 。）
7. Conditional probability: the following problem is loosely based on the television game show Let’s Make a Deal. At the end of the show, a contestant is asked to choose one of three large boxes, where one box contains a fabulous prize and the other two boxes contain lesser prizes. After the contestant chooses a box, Monty Hall, the host of the show, opens one of the two boxes containing smaller prizes. (In order to keep the conclusion suspenseful, Monty does not open the box selected by the contestant.) Monty offers the contestant the opportunity to switch from the chosen box to the remaining unopened box. Should the contestant switch or stay with the original choice? Calculate the probability that the contestant wins under each strategy. This is an exercise in being clear about the information that should be conditioned on when constructing a probability judgment. See Selvin (1975) and Morgan et al. (1991) for further discussion of this problem.
7. 条件概率：以下问题松散地基于电视游戏节目《让我们做交易》。在节目结束时，参赛者被要求从三个大箱子中选择一个，其中有一个箱子装有丰厚奖品，另外两个箱子装有较小的奖品。在参赛者选择了一个箱子后，节目主持人蒙蒂·霍尔打开了两个装有较小奖品中的一个。（为了保持悬念，蒙蒂不会打开参赛者所选的箱子。）蒙蒂给参赛者提供了将所选箱子换成剩下未打开箱子的机会。参赛者应该换箱还是坚持原选择？计算在每种策略下参赛者获胜的概率。这是一个关于在构建概率判断时应对哪些信息进行条件化的练习。有关此问题的进一步讨论，见 Selvin (1975) 和 Morgan 等人 (1991)。
8. Subjective probability: discuss the following statement. ‘The probability of event E is considered “subjective” if two rational persons A and B can assign unequal probabilities to E , P A ( E ) E , P A ( E ) E,P_(A)(E)\mathrm{E}, P_{A}(E) and P B ( E ) P B ( E ) P_(B)(E)P_{B}(E). These probabilities can also be interpreted as “conditional”: P A ( E ) = P ( E ∣ I A ) P A ( E ) = P E ∣ I A P_(A)(E)=P(E∣I_(A))P_{A}(E)=P\left(E \mid I_{A}\right) and P B ( E ) = P ( E ∣ I B ) P B ( E ) = P E ∣ I B P_(B)(E)=P(E∣I_(B))P_{B}(E)=P\left(E \mid I_{B}\right), where I A I A I_(A)I_{A} and I B I B I_(B)I_{B} represent the knowledge available to persons A and B, respectively.’ Apply this idea to the following examples.
8. 主观概率：讨论以下陈述。“如果两个理性的人 A 和 B 可以对事件 E 赋予不相等的概率（例如 E , P A ( E ) E , P A ( E ) E,P_(A)(E)\mathrm{E}, P_{A}(E) 和 P B ( E ) P B ( E ) P_(B)(E)P_{B}(E) ），则认为事件 E 的概率是‘主观的’。这些概率也可以解释为‘条件性’： P A ( E ) = P ( E ∣ I A ) P A ( E ) = P E ∣ I A P_(A)(E)=P(E∣I_(A))P_{A}(E)=P\left(E \mid I_{A}\right) 和 P B ( E ) = P ( E ∣ I B ) P B ( E ) = P E ∣ I B P_(B)(E)=P(E∣I_(B))P_{B}(E)=P\left(E \mid I_{B}\right) ，其中 I A I A I_(A)I_{A} 和 I B I B I_(B)I_{B} 分别代表 A 和 B 可获得的知识。”将这一观点应用到以下例子。
(a) The probability that a ‘6’ appears when a fair die is rolled, where A observes the outcome of the die roll and B does not.
(a) 掷一枚公正的骰子出现‘6’的概率，其中 A 观察到骰子点数的结果而 B 未观察到。
(b) The probability that Brazil wins the next World Cup, where A is ignorant of soccer and B B BB is a knowledgeable sports fan.
(b) 巴西队赢得下一届世界杯的概率，其中 A 对足球一无所知，而 B B BB 是一位对体育颇有见识的球迷。
9. Simulation of a queuing problem: a clinic has three doctors. Patients come into the clinic at random, starting at 9 a.m., according to a Poisson process with time parameter 10 minutes: that is, the time after opening at which the first patient appears follows an exponential distribution with expectation 10 minutes and then, after each patient arrives, the waiting time until the next patient is independently exponentially distributed, also with expectation 10 minutes. When a patient arrives, he or she waits until a doctor is available. The amount of time spent by each doctor with each patient is a random variable, uniformly distributed between 5 and 20 minutes. The office stops admitting new patients at 4 p.m. and closes when the last patient is through with the doctor.
9. 排队问题的模拟：一个诊所有三名医生。病人在上午 9 点开始随机到达，遵循参数为 10 分钟的泊松过程：也就是说，开门后第一个病人出现的时间服从期望为 10 分钟的指数分布，之后每位病人到达后，直到下一位病人的等待时间也独立地服从期望为 10 分钟的指数分布。病人到达时，会等待直到有医生可用。每位医生看每位病人的时间是一个随机变量，均匀分布在 5 到 20 分钟之间。诊所下午 4 点停止接收新病人，并在最后一位病人看完后关门。
(a) Simulate this process once. How many patients came to the office? How many had to wait for a doctor? What was their average wait? When did the office close?
(a) 对该过程进行一次模拟。有多少病人来到诊所？有多少人不得不等待医生？他们的平均等待时间是多少？诊所何时关门？
(b) Simulate the process 100 times and estimate the median and 50 % 50 % 50%50 \% interval for each of the summaries in (a).
(b) 将该过程模拟 100 次，并估计(a)中各项汇总量的中位数和 50 % 50 % 50%50 \% 区间。
